scenario: You want to ask your teacher for extra credit.
why_short: It doesn't say which class or why you need it!
improved_prompt: Write a polite email to my science teacher asking for extra credit to boost my grade after the last test.

scenario: You're making an ad for cool new headphones.
why_short: It doesn't say who would buy them or what makes them awesome!
improved_prompt: Write an exciting ad for teens about the X-200 headphones and their super long battery life.

scenario: You need to summarize a news article.
why_short: It doesn't say how long the summary should be!
improved_prompt: Summarize this article for students in one paragraph of about 200 words.

scenario: You want a chocolate cake recipe.
why_short: It doesn't say how big the cake should be or if it's easy to make!
improved_prompt: Give me an easy gluten-free chocolate cake recipe for 8 people.

scenario: You're writing a welcome message for your club's newsletter.
why_short: It doesn't tell new members what to do next!
improved_prompt: Write a friendly welcome message asking new members to reply with their favorite hobby.

scenario: You need to tell your club about a new meeting time.
why_short: It doesn't make the change sound good!
improved_prompt: Write a nice message about the new meeting time that explains why it's better for everyone.

scenario: You need a study schedule.
why_short: This one is actually great! It lists subjects, times, and days clearly.
improved_prompt: Create a 2-week study plan for my exams covering Math and English, with 1 hour per subject each weekday and a practice test on Saturdays.

scenario: You want to fix a slow Python script.
why_short: This one is spot on! It asks for exactly what's needed.
improved_prompt: Review the attached Python script for speed issues only, and give me the top 3 ways to make it faster.

scenario: You want an AI to check your math homework.
why_short: The AI can't check without seeing the problem first!
improved_prompt: Here's the problem: '2x + 5 = 15'. I got x = 5. Is that right?

scenario: You want feedback on a message you wrote.
why_short: The AI doesn't know what the message says or who it's for!
improved_prompt: I'm writing to my group project partners about a deadline. Does this sound nice? [Paste your message]

scenario: You want code that gives letter grades.
why_short: 'Normal grading' means different things to different people!
improved_prompt: Write a Python function to grade scores: A is 90-100, B is 80-89, C is 70-79, and so on.

scenario: You want to change a recipe to feed more people.
why_short: It doesn't say how many people you're cooking for!
improved_prompt: Change this pancake recipe to feed 10 people instead of 4: [Paste recipe here]

scenario: You want an intro for a travel blog post.
why_short: It doesn't say where you went or what was cool!
improved_prompt: Write a blog intro about my trip to Japan and all the amazing food I tried.

scenario: You're planning a weekend trip.
why_short: It doesn't say what you like to do or how much to spend!
improved_prompt: Plan a 3-day NYC trip for friends who love art and trying new food, with a medium budget.

scenario: You need to organize messy data.
why_short: This is great! It gives the data and says exactly how to organize it.
improved_prompt: Turn this messy CSV 'Name,Role;Sarah,Editor;Tom,Writer' into a clean JSON list with 'name' and 'role' for each person.

scenario: You're explaining a game to younger kids.
why_short: This is good! It says who the kids are and where they're playing.
improved_prompt: Explain the rules of 'Capture the Flag' to 10-year-olds using simple words, for playing outdoors.

scenario: You want a short summary of a really long book.
why_short: You can't fit a giant book into just 10 words!
improved_prompt: Summarize the main idea of 'Harry Potter' in one sentence under 20 words.

scenario: You want to play a story game with AI.
why_short: The game has no setting or rules yet!
improved_prompt: Let's play a game set in a haunted house. I'm a detective. You describe what I see in each room.

scenario: You need to respond to someone who's upset about something.
why_short: It doesn't say to be understanding or helpful!
improved_prompt: Write a polite reply to someone upset about their late package and offer to help fix it.

scenario: You need a catchy slogan for coffee.
why_short: It asks for too many ideas in just 3 words!
improved_prompt: Write a rhyming coffee slogan about morning energy that's under 6 words.

scenario: You want a workout plan.
why_short: It doesn't say if you have equipment or your fitness level!
improved_prompt: Give me a 30-minute workout for beginners with no equipment needed.

scenario: You need a movie for family movie night.
why_short: It doesn't say the age rating or what kind of movie!
improved_prompt: Recommend 3 fun animated adventure movies rated PG for kids around 7-12 years old.

scenario: You need a super strong password.
why_short: This is perfect! It gives all the rules for length and characters.
improved_prompt: Make a random password that's 16 characters long with symbols, numbers, and uppercase letters, but no repeating characters.

scenario: You can't make it to a friend's party.
why_short: This is good! It says to be polite and gives the reason.
improved_prompt: Write a polite message saying I can't come to the party because I'll be on vacation that weekend.

scenario: You need a grocery list.
why_short: It doesn't say if it should be a list or a paragraph!
improved_prompt: Give me a bulleted list of 10 healthy snacks, grouped by food type.

scenario: You want to organize feedback from friends.
why_short: It doesn't say what columns or headers to use!
improved_prompt: Put this feedback into a table with columns: 'Name', 'Issue', 'Feeling', and 'Suggestion'.

scenario: You want to get data for an app you're building.
why_short: It asks for JSON but doesn't list what info to include!
improved_prompt: Turn names and phone numbers into a JSON list with 'name' and 'phone' for each person.

scenario: You want to compare two phones.
why_short: A table is way better than a wall of text for comparing things!
improved_prompt: Make a comparison table for iPhone 15 and Samsung S24 showing Price, Battery, and Screen size.

scenario: You're writing a poem.
why_short: A spreadsheet format (CSV) is a weird choice for a poem!
improved_prompt: Write a poem about the ocean with three stanzas of 4 lines each.

scenario: You need notes from a group meeting.
why_short: It needs headers to be easy to read!
improved_prompt: Summarize this meeting into notes with headers: 'Who was there', 'What we talked about', and 'Next steps'.

scenario: You're converting units in a recipe.
why_short: This is great! It asks for a specific table with exact columns.
improved_prompt: Convert this recipe to metric and make a table with columns: 'Ingredient', 'Metric Amount', 'Original Amount'.

scenario: You want comments explaining your code.
why_short: This is perfect! It says exactly which style guide to follow.
improved_prompt: Add Python docstrings to each function in my code, following the Google Docstring Style Guide.
